intro: Crataegus floridana f. flava, commonly known as the Florida hawthorn, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree characterized by its yellowish flowers and red berries. The plant belongs to the Rosaceae family and is distinguished by its thorned branches and elliptical leaves. Its botanical features include small, white to yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by edible fruits. The species is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
